intro: Roettlera platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-calyx roettlera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
